testCases.explanation: The subtree rooted at node 4 in root is identical to subRoot
Node 4's subtree in root has an extra child 0, so it doesn't match subRoot exactly
Single node root equals single node subRoot
Leaf node with value 1 matches subRoot [1]

description: Given the roots of two binary trees root and subRoot, return true if there is a subtree of root with the same structure and node values of subRoot and false otherwise. A subtree of a binary tree tree is a tree that consists of a node in tree and all of this node's descendants. The tree tree could also be considered as a subtree of itself.

examples.explanation: The subtree rooted at 4 matches subRoot.
The node 4 has an extra child 0, so it does not match subRoot.

constraints: The number of nodes in the root tree is in the range [1, 2000]
The number of nodes in the subRoot tree is in the range [1, 1000]
